resource.string: Younger Sons
The convoy of gold from Tolosa is making its way back towards Rome. if the Junii hope to claim treasure as their own, now would be the moment to act.
The convoy of gold from Tolosa is making its way back towards Rome. if the Julii hope to claim treasure as their own, now would be the moment to act.
A strange old woman has appeared offering to sell you nine books of prophecy.
A Bountiful Hunt
Looters!
"A woman in your family stands accused of witchcraft! Her recent arrival marked the start of a terrible drought and the people fear her and her ""powers""."
As your dominions grow, the need to fill your coffers increases. Of the many lucrative endeavours open to you, which seems most profitable?
A chariotmaker has built a forge and, if the rumours are true, his work could rival that of the Smith-God!
The Silk Trade
Your daughter is with child. She swears she has never known the touch of a man and believes that the child is a gift from Mars, the god of war.
Blessed by the gods
A young boy with an uncanny resemblance to a member of your family has appeared. He claims to be the man's son by the daughter of another patrician family.
Spare the Whip
On of your magistrates is claiming his lands are barren. The harvest has failed, and the farmers worry the same will happen next year if nothing is done.
The Price of Mercy
Ill Omens
This new gang leader isn't afraid to bloody his hands. He has already attempted to expand his grain empire beyond Rome.
A lanista, hoping to gain favour, has performed a number of unsavoury tasks for a family member. This scum is now attempting to blackmail you.
Laconophilia
Parched Earth
A merchant from distant lands wishes to trade with our people. He has a regular supply of silk, that amazing, rare and sought-after commodity.
Nectar of the Gods
The Mystery of the Sands
A servant from the house of a rival family has been discussing their secrets in the market. She may have valuable information that we could use to discredit our rivals.
The Riddle of Metal
Slaves, Slaves, Everywhere
Economic Intent
The Witchcraft
Munera
Munera
A gosan has written a mocking poem about one of your generals. The man is outraged and demands that something be done to restore his tattered honour.
The Stranger
Long Lost Son
We have captured an enemy scout! He was sent by his masters to uncover our weaknesses! What should be done to him?
Dark Deeds
The Hidden Forge
Does this man have no shame?! We have received word that he is using the power of our family name to intimidate his creditors!
Baleful Stars
The Chickens have Spoken
Dark Deeds
Sanctuary
A Bloody Secret
Sparta's unwavering traditions have gained respect in the Hellenic world. Many who aspire to a Spartan way of life copy our ways. Should this continue?
The Poisoner's Art
There are rumours of an old blacksmith who lives in the depths of the forest. People claim that he forges the finest spearheads and swords the world has ever seen.
There are rumours that a sacred sword has been pulled from its stone. The people whisper of a leader whose coming was long foretold.
No Shame!
Philosophy of Cavalry
A Lust for Life
When you arrive to make the exchange the woman walks calmly to her husbands side, takes his sword and decapitates her kidnapper.
Your general has got a pet fawn: the creature is milk-white and follows him around like a loyal dog. He claims it is a gift from the gods of the forest.
The Horned Governor
A member of your family has been unfaithful with one of her husband's shield-bearers. The man is furious and calls for the right to take his wife's life.
The Golden Gaul
A merchant from distant lands wishes to trade with our people. He has a regular supply of silk, that amazing, rare and sought-after commodity.
The convoy carrying the Gold of Tolosa is heading towards Carthage. If the Hannonids hope to claim the treasure they must act.
A Question of Independence
We cannot let the murder of a Roman legate go unpunished.
Despite your undoubted military might, some have drawn attention to the fact that your cavalry lacks strength and numbers.
One of your magistrates is complaining about the lack of slaves in his province. He feels that more slaves would help to improve the productivity of his lands and boost the local economy.
Corruption
Favoured by the Gods
A member of your family has been found guilty of poisoning his ward to inherit the boy's lands. What would you have us do with him?
Does the greed of mercenaries know no bounds? These soldiers-for-hire are demanding more gold for their so-called skills! What will you do?
Pirates!
Child of Mars
Child of Ill-repute
We are surrounded! The men need inspiration! But what should your general say to his men?
Following the death of our leader the tribe has chosen his youngest son to succeed him. Angered by this decision, the eldest son is rallying men to his banner.
Our people have become lustful and hedonistic, thinking only of pleasure and failing to give the gods the respect they deserve.
A Carthaginian captain has been captured. As head officer of a trade fleet he will have knowledge of trade routes and destinations that could prove profitable.
Kidnapped
The Djinn is offering to take you deeper into the desert to find the forgotten treasure of a long-dead king.
A Roman soldier has been found looting offerings from our sacred lake! What should be done with him?
Our enemies grow bold and we must look to our defences. Should we rely on the strength of our warriors or strengthen our diplomatic ties?
A dust-stained and travel-worn stranger seeks an audience. He claims to have knowledge of the whereabouts of a djinn!
Keeping the Peace
The Need For Cavalry
The Silk Trade
Our lands are wracked with drought! We must do something to appease the gods!
A Beast with no Heart
The Germanic people do not care for the like the Gauls, but gold and silver are vital to trade, and war without iron is a fool's game. What is most important?
Blessed by the Gods
Death of a Legend
Blackmail
Provincial Migration
The head of an enemy warrior, taken in battle, has started talking to its owner. It repeatedly speaks of the doom of our people.
One of your magistrates is complaining about the lack of slaves in his province. He feels that more slaves would help to improve the productivity of his lands and boost the local economy.
A traveller from distant lands has appeared offering to sell you the bones of a griffin.
The Nisean Legend
This woman is with child. She claims, openly and in the streets, that the father is a man of your blood. A bastard from a hetaira can ruin a man's reputation.
Phryne was seen dancing naked in the streets during a festival dedicated to Poseidon. This disgraceful act offends Poseidon and Athena!
This hetaira has been the companion of your general for some time but now she rejects his advances. The man is humiliating himself in his attempts to win her back.
A beautiful young hetaira has been stoned to death by local women, jealous of her beauty and talent.
The wife of one of your magistrates is claiming that a young general forced himself upon her. Her husband has come to you seeking permission to kill the young man.
In order to pay for the upkeep of the temples, the High Priestess intends to introduce a temple tax.
The Greek Affair
Young Pilgrims
The Gold of Tolosa
Fallen Vestal
A member of your family is seeking vengeance for the murder of her husband. She wants your permission to hire a man to track her husband's murderer and bring him to justice.
The seas have been becalmed for quite some time. If we are to trade, and send warships against our enemies, we must make regain the favour of Poseidon by an offering…
A distant member of the family shows signs of greatness. Despite his age, it is said that the boy is a natural leader.
As your enemies gain strength it is important to have a well-balanced military. With that in mind, what kind of training would you like to focus on?
Deep in an abandoned vault, a librarian has found a set of ancient scrolls, containing long-forgotten knowledge.
The Word of a Slave
They plunder was cast into nearby lakes. It seems that misfortune made the Volcae believe the gold was cursed. They offered it to their gods in hope of salvation!
Nisean Stallions
These scheming women have tricked you! This cannot stand!
Those with great wealth and power should contribute to the glory of Rome. Having declared themselves to be the Rome's most influential family, the Cornelii decide to…
A beautiful young woman has arrived at court. She is a gift from a foreign ruler seeking to gain your favour.
Word has reached us of a Gallic slave whose skills as a goldsmith are fast becoming legend.
Baleful Stars
Black Sheep
Nectar of the Gods
Birds have been seen flying in the Senate! This is the worst possible omen! The gods are furious!
The Price of Devotion
The lakes near Tolosa brim with treasure! The Volcae must have thought the gold accursed, and offered it to the gods to end their misfortunes. Now, we must make a decision.
Kidnapped

There are rumours at court that a favoured concubine wishes to place her son on the throne. News of this intrigue has reached us from her fellow concubines, who were more than happy to reveal her plans.
A member of your family has been caught hunting sacred hares. The people of the tribe are demanding blood!
Vengeance
A young member of a rival family has found himself with serious debts. Perhaps we can use this to our advantage…
The Gold of Tolosa
A trader has arrived from Nisea, claiming to sell the finest horses in the known world!
Many plebs are unable to find work thanks to the use of slaves for skilled and menial labour, In one province, the workers have become destitute. What should be done to help?
The Dolphin Rider
A merchant has come to you seeking protection for his caravan. Bandits have been targeting the trade routes around your lands and he fears an attack.
Forbidden Knowledge
The Games! Entertainment for the masses and manly virtues to admire! However, the arena needs a great many gladiators, and senators worry about such a slave army in our midst. What should be done?
The Golden Gaul
The Gold of Tolosa
Long Lost Son

The legends were true! The Volcae, fearing their plunder was cursed, threw it into the lakes of Tolosa as offerings to the gods. The lakes glitter with gold and precious gems, but what if the Volcae were right and the treasure is cursed…
Rome is surrounded by enemies. The gods send us a sign! Every priest agrees that the fiery, long-haired star in the night sky was sent by...
A member of your family is concerned about a reoccurring dream. In her dream, a dark cloud descended on your lands and engulfed your people.
An impressive hoard, indeed. The Gauls call it accursed, but should great wealth be ignored because what lesser men say?
Bad Omen
A merchant from the distant south wishes to trade incense and spices with our people.
The Hunt
A member of your family has come to plead with you to reinstate her son. The disgraced boy was banished from court, but his mother claims that he has learned the error of his ways.
Wrecking Reputations
Taken Their Jobs
The legends are true! The treasures glisten below the surface, but could these riches be cursed? Or was it a barbarian fear?
Blood and Circuses
Fire in the Sky
The Remembrance
The Evil Eye
The Gold of Tolosa
In the Dark of the Night
The pregnant wife of one of your generals has been captured by the enemy. They are offering to return her, for the right price.
A Vestal virgin has been found guilty of sexual impropriety. Her lover has already been flogged to death. What should be done with her?
As suspected, the girl had not listened to her betters and soon returned to her Greek lover. Something must be done…
Incense and Spice and All Things Nice
Lost Legionaries
Ruling foreigners is always difficult. In order to maintain control over their wayward kingdoms, Alexander's successors must consider new strategies, such as…
Munera
Oeconomica
Once again, the boy has disgraced the family name! Something must be done!
A merchant from distant lands has arrived in our lands. He has brought a strange new dye that creates a rich colour our people have never seen before.
One of your magistrates has fallen prey to the evil eye. His bad luck is seeping into the soil of his lands and the people go hungry.
Following the death of our mighty leader we must decide how to honour his memory.

A young boy in this province has befriended a dolphin. So great is their bond that the creature allowed the boy to saddle it. The spectacle drew visitors from far and wide and the cost of entertaining them is taking its toll on the province's finances.
The Price of Loyalty
A young boy with an uncanny resemblance to a member of your family has appeared. He claims to be the man's son by the daughter of another tribal leader.
The convoy of gold from Tolosa is making its way back towards Rome. if the Claudii hope to claim treasure as their own, now would be the moment to act.
Another family seeks to adopt one of your characters.
Foul Plots
Pirates!
A hoard worthy of Jupiter! Untold treasures, supposedly cursed, stolen from hapless Greeks, and drenched in Volcae blood! All cast into the waters to appease barbarian gods…
Your general's wife has been kidnapped. The kidnappers have sent word implying that they will trade the woman for gold and other treasures.
Hellenisation Woes
Thinkers have often sought to organise the management of the state and the self, such as in the works of Xenophon and Aristotle, but what do you think important?
One of our family members has been apprehended outside the Senate. She attacked a Senator who had spoken ill of her husband, stabbing him through the tongue with a hairpin.
The civil war is over. The time has come to decide a future for the Roman Republic.
As your power increases so does the need to develop your military capabilities and civic infrastructure. Which is of greater importance to your people?
A trader from distant lands has come to our land. He claims to be selling the finest horses known to man!
Mad as a March Hare
Tomb Robbers
Deadly Rumours

Our Thracian slave girl has been captured by a political opponent. A trusted member of our household for many years, she knows everything about our family. These people will use her knowledge to ruin us.
Child of Ill-repute
As Rome's borders expand, an increasing number of citizens are travelling to historical sites to gaze on their wonders. Which should be the most popular?
One of your magistrates is complaining about the deteriorating quality of wine in his province. He claims even barbarians would refuse to drink it!
The Gold of Tolosa
The Gift of Beauty
The Wife of the Magistrate
A once-lame man, cured in Epidaurus, is walking the streets and rejoicing. The people are abandoning their homes and work to follow him on a pilgrimage to honour the gods.
Vicious Words
Marriage
Wrath of Athena
A Question of Blood
Lost Love
Wrath of Aphrodite
Rampant Piracy
Egypt's ancient history is rich with treasures, monuments, temples and tombs. But desecration and theft of these ancient sites is becoming common place…
"There are rumours that ""the Hunt"" has been heard. The people fear divine wrath and look to you to appease the gods."
Blood is Blood
A Promising Youth
Martial Priorities
A Heavy Price
Developmental Focus
The Horses from Across the Sea
Good Omens
The Grand Tour
Your daughter's indiscretions are the talk of Rome. Her behaviour is discussed in hushed whispers by all the women of standing, and even the slaves smile about her exploits!
Blood is Blood
The tribal council has received word that a number of Roman deserters are roaming our lands> What should be done?
Deadly Rumours
A miner has come across a rich deposit of ore in the hills not far from one of your mines.
Tyrian Purple
Careless Sons
Cultural differences present a challenge to anyone who controls foreign lands. There are, however, ways to encourage foreigners to accept your mastery.
Bandits
Tomb Robbers
Pirates are a serious problem requiring your immediate attention. How would you like to deal with these sea-vermin?
The beautiful and charming woman was soon with child and gave birth to a son. She claims the child is of your blood.
A Heavy Price
Gladiator
Slaves, Slaves, Everywhere
Incense and Spice and all Things Nice
The Gold of Tolosa
Another family proposes a marriage.
Ill Omens
Oaken Whispers
Adoption
Your astrologers have fantastic news! The stars are coming into an alignment that will bring great prosperity to you and your people.
The fool! When the boy heard of the ransom you had paid he insisted he was worth more. The pirates are now demanding double!
A concubine has been found guilty of plotting to kill your wife. The mad woman believed you would chose her to be your new wife. How would you like to proceed?
Acculturation
A local fisherman has been luring ships on to the rocks near his home and profiting from the wrecks.
All that Glitters...
The Gold of Tolosa
The Gift of Beauty
In a madness of grief the child's mother has murdered her husband, one of your generals.
Questioning those responsible for recent desecrations has revealed that the robberies were masterminded by high-ranking government officials!
A traveller from Dodona brings word of ill omens at the Oracle. As the news spreads people panic, fearing the wrath of the gods.
A priestess from Dodona brings happy tidings! The rustling of the oak leaves has told her much of the future fortunes of our people.
Empire or Republic?
A member of our family has run up considerable debts. His actions have brought disgrace upon him and the whole family.
One of your magistrates is complaining about the number of slaves in his province. He fears they may soon outnumber citizens. Only the gods know what such madness may bring!
Gladiators have become valuable assets, no longer limited to dying in the arena. How should these assets be put to use?
A merchant from the distant south wishes to trade his incense and spices with our people.
Your astrologers warn that a child recently born into your family came into the world under baleful stars. This child's ill luck cannot be allowed to taint the rest of the family.
Angered by his young wife's behaviour your son-in-law demands that you do something immediately.
A member of your family has been captured by pirates! The sea-scum are offering to return the boy, in exchange for a substantial ransom.
A member of your family has been murdered by a brother. The killer is insisting that he had no choice: his brother chopped down a sacred tree and used it for firewood!
The leader of a vanquished tribe has arrived in your lands, seeking protection from his enemies.
The Slaver
Steps need to be taken if the terrible events foreshadowed by the dream are to be averted. What would you have us do?
The Greek Affair
The Stand
Riddles and Divination
Trouble on the Aventine
The Mystery of the Sands
Maintaining public order has become a serious problem for the governors of one particular province. How will you restore order?
A legendary gladiator nears the end of his time in the arena, and the streets are a-buzz with rumours of how he will end his illustrious career.
One of your magistrates is concerned about the high number of slaves in his province. He feels that this may prove dangerous.
Those with great wealth and power should contribute to the glory of Rome. Having declared themselves to be the Rome's most influential family, the Julii decide to…
Those with great wealth and power should contribute to the glory of Rome. Having declared themselves to be the Rome's most influential family, the Junii decide to…
A distant member of the family is said to have a pet eagle. The bird came to the boy and perched on his right shoulder, a sure sign of greatness!
The convoy carrying the Gold of Tolosa is heading towards Carthage. If the Magonids hope to claim the treasure they must act.
Poisoned Words
Your lands are in the grip of a terrible drought, and the people blame the presence of the ill-fated child.
Talking Heads
Maintaining your strength this far from home may prove difficult. You should consider hiring mercenaries to bolster your forces.
One of your family members is being blackmailed.
The keeper of the auspice chickens informs us that the birds have eaten heartily, a sure sign that we are favoured by the gods!
Scorpus, the legendary charioteer, has been killed during a race. The people are heartbroken and call for this great man to be honoured.
On of your magistrates informs us that his lands are barren. The harvest has failed, and the farmers worry the same will happen next year if nothing is done.
A hag has been spotted rising from the mists of a stream. The local people fear she may be a sign from the gods: a sign of terrible misfortune to come.
A member of your family is having an affair! With her Greek physician! O! The shame!
Trouble on the Aventine
A man sent friends to beg you to overturn his death sentence. They claim his crime does not fit the punishment handed down by your magistrate.
The astronomers warn of ill omens in the stars, signs that forewarn of a terrible flood.
The Sacred Sword
Brotherly Love
A gang has taken control of the ports in Rome and is attempting to control the city's grain supply.
Xenophon of Athens is held in high regard because of his views on cavalry and its uses. Which part of his war studoes do you thing creates the most effective cavalry units?
Grasping Lanista
The Shield-bearer
A Lack of Slaves
Word is spreading that the wife of a governor has taken a slave for a lover! She flaunts the relationship in Rome while her husband toils in his province.
The Gold of Tolosa
The Silk Trade
Cultists
Chalcon the Traveller
A Lack of Slaves
A priestess has arrived from Bura. The dice of the Oracle have foretold good fortune for our people!
It is not always easy for the Senate to watch over the provincial governors. Some, like this man, abuse the position. What should be done?
Slaves, Slaves, Everywhere
The Use of Mercenaries
One of your magistrates is complaining about a lack of slaves in his province. Public works are taking an age and some men don't even have bed slaves!
The Rython
A trusted haruspex has come to us with troubling news. While examining the innards of a boar he found that the beast had no heart! The gods are displeased!
The man is attempting to use Roman law to save his miserable life. He claims that a Roman citizen should not be put to death with foreigners and slaves.
A Lack of Slaves
The Bones of Monsters

The horses of Nisea are rightly thought the finest in the world. Your traders make an excellent living selling them but, as they sell more of them, the less prestigious these once-fabled beasts become.
Your general is seeking permission to sail down the Cloca Maxima. He feels the spectacle will provide distraction for the people and display this impressive piece of Roman architecture.
Prelude to War
Provinces far from Rome often lack of Roman citizens and culture. In exchange for lower relief, the Senate will encourage Romans to migrate, especially…
The Pale Fawn
One of your governors has been found dead. All the signs point towards poisoning, how should we proceed?
The Gold of Tolosa
One of your magistrates is complaining about the number of slaves in his province. He fears they may soon outnumber true Romans. Only the gods know what such madness may bring!
After hearing the riddle of Pythia of Delphoi, Chalcon and his wife have decided to pay you a visit.
Members of a strange new cult have been caught desecrating a temple of the gods! What would you like to do with these godless monsters?
Valuable Information
A member of your family has been dabbling in surgery. His skill with a knife leaves a little to be desired, and the pile of bodies is becoming difficult to hide.
Empire or Republic?
A group of warriors are preparing to ride out for the hunt. We should make offerings for their safe return and a successful chase!
The Gold of Tolosa
The Gold of Tolosa
A metalsmith is making rhyton of surpassing beauty. His skills are noteworthy, and only the rich and influential can hope to buy one of his pieces.
Word has reached us of a Gallic slave whose skills as a goldsmith are fast becoming legend.
The Smith Reborn
A merchant from distant lands has arrived. He wishes to trade his strange, shiny material with our people.
A distant member of the family is said to have a pet boar. The creature came to him during a hunt and bowed its head before him. It is said that the huge beast follows the boy everywhere.
Mercenary Demands
A beggar-priest has arrived from Delphoi. He speaks in riddles, uses divinations on the street, and babbles of the Oracle's ill omens. His words trouble the people…
Barren Lands
This man was once a slave but as a slave driver he is cruel and heartless. His lack of compassion and the regular beatings he gives are making the slaves rebellious.
A Filthy Spectacle
In the Dark of the Night
Slavers have arrived in your ports with a shipment of high quality slaves. But which of them catches your eye?
The Poisoner's Art
The convoy carrying the Gold of Tolosa is heading towards Carthage. If the Barcids hope to claim the treasure they must act.
Your general has got a pet fawn: the creature is milk-white and follows him around like a loyal dog. He claims it is a gift from Diana, the Huntress.
From the Mists
Barren Lands
Legend of the Sands
A Greek trader has come to the tribe offering to trade the sweet wines of his homeland.
The civil war is over. The time has come to decide upon a future for Carthage and her people.
The Value of Silence
The Gold of Tolosa
The Pale Fawn
nothing_nothing
